help.title: Help & Features
help.subtitle: Discover all the powerful features and capabilities of the AISP platform

overview.title: Mission dashboard overview
overview.description: The dashboard combines live video, map context, telemetry, and mission controls so operators can oversee a mission without leaving the page.

items.video: Review RGB and thermal feeds side-by-side, expand either feed to fullscreen, and capture frames whenever additional evidence is required.
items.map: Use the interactive map to track drone and base positions, inspect the geofence, and review recent physics logs when analysing motion.
items.mode: Switch between auto and manual flight. Manual mode exposes keyboard and on-screen controls for precision adjustments.

telemetry.title: Telemetry and system health
telemetry.description: Grouped telemetry tiles surface the latest battery, flight, communications, GNSS, weather, and docking station readings so you can validate mission readiness at a glance.

items.tiles: Colour-coded tiles highlight power, connectivity, navigation, mission progress, and dock mechanics. Hover to see thresholds and recent events.
items.flight: Track altitude, heading, horizontal and vertical speed, and GNSS lock. Mission ETA updates automatically with real-time progress.
items.alerts: Tiles switch to yellow or red when metrics drift from nominal ranges, helping you prioritise corrective actions.

timeline.title: Mission timeline and logs
timeline.description: Mission status, physics updates, and operational logs live in the right column. Use them to retrace actions and document anomalies.

items.progress: Mission progress highlights the current stage and upcoming steps. Auto missions show a progress bar; manual missions swap in live instructions.
items.log: The operational log records mode changes, docking actions, and operator notes for audit-ready mission history.
items.physics: Physics events call out max-speed moments, boundary bounces, or motion state changes that explain unexpected behaviour.

controls.title: Manual control tools
controls.description: When you switch to manual mode, the dashboard provides keyboard shortcuts and on-screen buttons so pilots can steer the drone without leaving the workspace.

items.keyboard: Use the arrow keys to adjust thrust and yaw. The on-screen pad mirrors your inputs and prevents the map from stealing focus.
items.actions: Pause, send the drone home, or toggle between auto and manual directly from the control bar.
items.safety: Boundary clamping keeps manual flights inside the geo-fenced area. Status banners confirm docking state before you hand control back to auto.

layout.title: Understand the layout
layout.description: Left column houses live video feeds. Right column stacks the map, telemetry, mission progress, and logs, adapting to the current mode.

video.title: Master the video tools
video.description: Expand a feed for detailed inspections, then collapse to compare streams. Use capture buttons to gather imagery mid-flight.

telemetry.title: Keep telemetry in context
telemetry.description: Hover any status tile for guidance. Values include explanations so you can brief teammates or compile reports quickly.

quickTips.title: Quick tips for operators
items: Expand a video feed before printing or sharing screenshots to remove interface chrome.
Switch to manual mode for fine positioning—arrow keys and the on-screen pad stay responsive even with the map focused.
Treat yellow and red tiles as prompts: hover to read the threshold and recommended follow-up.
Copy key entries from the operational log after each flight to build a mission appendix.
Use the map legend to confirm airspace boundaries before authorising manual manoeuvres.

guides.title: Step-by-step workflow guides
guides.intro: Use these checklists to prepare, supervise, and finalise every mission.

preFlight.title: Pre-flight readiness
preFlight.description: Complete these checks before arming the mission.
steps: Verify camera feeds are online and expand each briefly to confirm clarity.
Review the map geofence and planned mission path for obstructions or restricted zones.
Check telemetry tiles for green status; resolve any yellow/red indicators, especially power and connectivity.
Confirm the dock shows a closed hatch, charging complete, and mission selection correct.

onMission.title: During the mission
onMission.description: Monitor live systems while the drone is airborne.
steps: Pin the mission progress card to track the current stage and ETA.
Hover telemetry tiles when status changes to understand context and decide corrective actions.
Use the control bar to pause or return home if weather or communications degrade.
Log noteworthy events in the operational log so the handover team sees the same context.

postFlight.title: Post-flight wrap-up
postFlight.description: Capture learnings and archive mission data.
steps: Switch back to auto mode once the drone is docked and confirm charging resumes.
Download mission imagery or clips directly from the expanded video feed if evidence is required.
Export relevant log entries and attach them to the mission report in the Archive.
Reset alerts and verify all telemetry tiles return to nominal values before closing the session.

dashboard.printNote: Print view hides navigation chrome and preserves only the content within this help page.

manual.title: Operator manual
manual.intro: Follow these procedures whenever you interact with key dashboard areas. Each topic lists the expected outcome and the recommended steps.

topics.title: Video workspace
topics.description: Monitor feeds, capture evidence, and troubleshoot streaming issues.
steps: Hover a feed to reveal expand, snapshot, and clip controls. Use expand for detailed inspections, then collapse to restore the split view.
If a feed stalls, refresh the stream by collapsing and re-expanding it. Persistent issues usually indicate upstream encoder problems—log them immediately.
Capture snapshots for incident reports. Clips longer than 30 seconds should be queued for archive export after the flight.

topics.title: Mission map
topics.description: Keep spatial awareness and validate the drone remains inside the geofence.
steps: Toggle layers from the legend to compare planned paths with the actual trace.
Zoom out whenever physics logs warn about boundary bounces, then adjust manual inputs or revise waypoints accordingly.
Use marker tooltips to confirm the latest GNSS fix and heading before authorising manual manoeuvres.

topics.title: Telemetry tiles
topics.description: Interpret subsystem status and respond to alerts quickly.
steps: Scan the colour of each tile row-by-row. Prioritise red alerts (critical), then investigate yellow warnings.
Open the tooltip for any tile that changes colour to understand thresholds, historical values, and suggested actions.
Record follow-up actions in the operational log to close the feedback loop for maintenance teams.

topics.title: Mission controls
topics.description: Execute decisive actions without leaving the dashboard.
steps: Use Pause to hold position while you analyse telemetry or weather changes.
Trigger Return to Home when the mission must abort—confirm the docking bay is clear before issuing the command.
Toggle Manual/Auto only when you have joystick authority. Log the reason for each mode change for post-flight audits.
